user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_sysconf_fallback_:
```c
static int
mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_sysconf_fallback_ (void)
{
  int ret = -1;
#if defined(HAVE_SYSCONF) && \
  (defined(HAS_DECL__SC_CRAY_NCPU) || defined(HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF))
  long value = -1;
#ifdef HAS_DECL__SC_CRAY_NCPU
  if (0 >= value)
    value = sysconf (_SC_CRAY_NCPU);
#endif /* HAS_DECL__SC_CRAY_NCPU */
#ifdef HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF
  if (0 >= value)
    value = sysconf (_SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF);
#endif /* HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF */
  if (0 >= value)
    return -1;
  ret = (int) value;
  if ((long) ret != value)
    return -1; /* Overflow */
#endif /* HAVE_SYSCONF &&
          (HAS_DECL__SC_CRAY_NCPU || HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF) */
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_sysconf_fallback_:
#define HAVE_SYSCONF 1
...
#define HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF 1
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Given the provided macro definitions, the remainder of the function is part of the compiled translation unit and its execution paths depend on the runtime return value of sysconf(), so those statements are not statically unreachable: the if-guards before each sysconf call depend on the mutable variable 'value' (initialized to -1) and thus can evaluate either way at runtime; the subsequent check for non-positive value and the overflow check depend on the sysconf result and are therefore reachable. No other code fragments in the function are obviously unreachable under the current build configuration and realistic runtime outcomes, so they do not require investigation for MISRA Rule 2.1.
